From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Medieval Latin policia, from Late Latin polītīa.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ˌpo.liˈt͡saɪ̯]
  • Rhymes: -aɪ̯
  • Hyphenation: Po‧li‧zei
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Audio (Austria):(file)

Noun

[edit]

Polizei f (genitive Polizei, plural Polizeien)

  1. police; law enforcement
    Die Polizei erwischte den Taschendieb auf frischer Tat.
    The police caught the pickpocket in the act.

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Polizei [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Polizei die Polizeien
genitive einer der Polizei der Polizeien
dative einer der Polizei den Polizeien
accusative eine die Polizei die Polizeien

Descendants

[edit]
  • → Bulgarian: полица́й (policáj)
  • → Czech: policie
  • → Lower Sorbian: policaj
  • → Pannonian Rusyn: полицай (policaj)
  • → Romanian: polițai
  • → Russian: полица́й (policáj)
  • → Slovene: policaj
  • → Ukrainian: поліца́й (policáj)

Plautdietsch

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

Polizei f

  1. police
